org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.util

Class CoverageMapBuilder<T extends Rangeable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.util.CoverageMapBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Rangeable type that will be used to back the CoverageMap.

    public final class CoverageMapBuilder<T extends Rangeable>
extends Object
    CoverageMapBuilder will build a CoverageMap of the given elements. The Builder has optional methods for filtering what reads get included in the CoverageMap to be built. Once all the options have been set, build() will construct the actual CoverageMap instance.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoverageMapBuilder(Collection<T> elements)
      Create a new Builder instance that will use the given elements to eventually build a CoverageMap.

    • Method Detail

      • maxAllowedCoverage

        public CoverageMapBuilder<T> maxAllowedCoverage(int maxCoverage)
        Set the maximum coverage depth any CoverageRegion in the resulting CoverageMap will have, any elements that provide additional coverage than the specified max will not be included in the CoverageMap.

        This exclusion is performed by computing element arrival and departure values so the first elements providing coverage by start coordinate will be included while the "maxCoverage-th" read will be excluded: In the following diagram, if maxCoverage is set to 4, then element7 will be excluded because it causes 5x coverage at some of its offsets. 

         ---------------------------
 1x|    =element1=   =element5=
 2x|      =element2=    =element6=
 3x|      =element3=     =element8=
 4x|        =element4=   
 5x|         =element7=
        Parameters:
        maxCoverage - the maxCoverage any CoverageRegion will be allowed to have; must be ≥ 0.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxCoverage < 0.

      • maxAllowedCoverage

        public CoverageMapBuilder<T> maxAllowedCoverage(int preferredMaxCoverage,
                                                int requiredMinCoverage)
        Set the PREFERRED maximum coverage depth any CoverageRegion in the resulting CoverageMap will have. Any AssembledRead in the Contig that provides additional coverage than the specified max will not be included in the CoverageMap EXCEPT if there are other nearby CoverageRegions whose coverage depth will be below the specified requiredMinCoverage.

        This exclusion is performed by computing element arrival and departure values so the first elements providing coverage by start coordinate will be included while the "maxCoverage-th" element will be excluded: In the following diagram, if maxCoverage is set to 4 and requiredMinCoverage is set to 2, then element7 will still be included because even though it causes 5x coverage at some of its offsets, the end of the read provides 2x coverage at that position so the read must stay. 

         ---------------------------
 1x|    =element1=   =element5=
 2x|      =element2=    =element6=
 3x|      =element3=     =element8=
 4x|        =element4=   
 5x|         =element7=
        Parameters:
        preferredMaxCoverage - the maximum coverage any CoverageRegion will strive to have; must be ≥ 0.
        requiredMinCoverage - the minimum coverage any CoverageRegion must have even at the expense of exceeding the preferredMaxCoverage; must be ≥ 0.
        Returns:
        this

      • build

        public CoverageMap<T> build()
        Create a new CoverageMap instance using the contig provided by this constructor and filtered by any options set.
        Returns:
        a new CoverageMap; will never be null but may be empty.

      • includeOrigin

        public CoverageMapBuilder<T> includeOrigin(boolean flag)
        Forces a CoverageRegion to cover the origin (offset 0) in the coverage map. If this is set to true then the first CoverageRegion of the built CoverageMap will always have a CoverageRegion that will cover offset 0. If there is no coverage at offset zero, then a CoverageRegion that has CoverageRegion.getCoverageDepth() ==0 (a 0x region) will be inserted into the map even if it that makes it the first or last region in the map.

        If not set, then defaults to false.

        Parameters:
        flag - true to include the origin; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this
